LimitedComplex.pm

00001 ##########################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements a context in which complex numbers can be entered,
00004 #  but no complex operations are permitted.  So students will
00005 #  be able to perform operations within the real and imaginary
00006 #  parts of the complex numbers, but not between complex numbers.
00007 #
00008 #
00009 #  Complex Numbers can still be entered in a+bi or a*e^(bt) form.
00010 #  The e and i are allowed to be entered only once, so we have
00011 #  to keep track of that, and allow SOME complex operations,
00012 #  but only when one term is one of these constants (or an expression
00013 #  involving it that we've already OKed).
00014 #
00015 #  You control which format to use by setting the complex_format
00016 #  context flag to 'cartesian', 'polar' or 'either'. E.g.,
00017 #
00018 #      Context()->flags->set(complex_format => 'polar');
00019 #
00020 #  The default is 'either'.  There are predefined contexts that
00021 #  already have these values set:
00022 #
00023 #      Context("LimitedComplex-cartesian");
00024 #      Context("LimitedComplex-polar");
00025 #
00026 #  You can require that the a and b used in these forms be strictly
00027 #  numbers (not expressions) by setting the strict_numeric flag and
00028 #  disabling all the functions:
00029 #
00030 #      Context()->flags->set(strict_numeric=>1);
00031 #      Context()->functions->disable('All');
00032 #
00033 #  There are predefined contexts that already have these values
00034 #  set:
00035 #
00036 #      Context("LimitedComplex-cartesian-strict");
00037 #      Context("LimitedComplex-polar-strict");
00038 #      Context("LimitedComplex-strict");
00039 #
00040 
00041 #
00042 #  Handle common checking for BOPs
00043 #
00044 package Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP;
00045 
00046 #
00047 #  Do original check and then if the operands are numbers, its OK.
00048 #  Otherwise, do an operator-specific check for if complex numbers are OK.
00049 #  Otherwise report an error.
00050 #
00051 sub _check {
00052   my $self = shift;
00053   my $super = ref($self); $super =~ s/Legacy::LimitedComplex:://;
00054   &{$super."::_check"}($self);
00055   if ($self->{lop}->isRealNumber && $self->{rop}->isRealNumber) {
00056     return unless $self->{equation}{context}{flags}{strict_numeric};
00057   } else {
00058     Value::Error("The constant 'i' may appear only once in your formula")
00059       if ($self->{lop}->isComplex and $self->{rop}->isComplex);
00060     return if $self->checkComplex;
00061     $self->Error("Exponential form is 'a*e^(bi)'")
00062       if $self->{lop}{isPower} || $self->{rop}{isPower};
00063   }
00064   $self->Error("Your answer should be of the form %s",$self->theForm)
00065 }
00066 
00067 #
00068 #  filled in by subclasses
00069 #
00070 sub checkComplex {return 0}
00071 
00072 #
00073 #  Get the form for use in error messages
00074 #
00075 sub theForm {
00076   my $self = shift;
00077   my $format = $self->{equation}{context}{flags}{complex_format};
00078   return 'a+bi' if $format eq 'cartesian';
00079   return 'a*e^(bi)' if $format eq 'polar';
00080   return 'a+bi or a*e^(bi)';
00081 }
00082 
00083 ##############################################
00084 #
00085 #  Now we get the individual replacements for the operators
00086 #  that we don't want to allow.  We inherit everything from
00087 #  the original Parser::BOP class, and just add the
00088 #  complex checks here.  Note that checkComplex only
00089 #  gets called if exactly one of the terms is complex
00090 #  and the other is real.
00091 #
00092 
00093 package Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::add;
00094 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP Parser::BOP::add);
00095 
00096 sub checkComplex {
00097   my $self = shift;
00098   return 0 if $self->{equation}{context}{flags}{complex_format} eq 'polar';
00099   my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00100   if ($l->isComplex) {my $tmp = $l; $l = $r; $r = $tmp};
00101   return $r->class eq 'Constant' || $r->{isMult} ||
00102     ($r->class eq 'Complex' && $r->{value}[0] == 0);
00103 }
00104 
00105 ##############################################
00106 
00107 package Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::subtract;
00108 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP Parser::BOP::subtract);
00109 
00110 sub checkComplex {
00111   my $self = shift;
00112   return 0 if $self->{equation}{context}{flags}{complex_format} eq 'polar';
00113   my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00114   if ($l->isComplex) {my $tmp = $l; $l = $r; $r = $tmp};
00115   return $r->class eq 'Constant' || $r->{isMult} ||
00116     ($r->class eq 'Complex' && $r->{value}[0] == 0);
00117 }

00119 ##############################################
00120 
00121 package Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::multiply;
00122 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP Parser::BOP::multiply);
00123 
00124 sub checkComplex {
00125   my $self = shift;
00126   my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00127   $self->{isMult} = !$r->{isPower};
00128   return (($l->class eq 'Constant' || $l->isRealNumber) &&
00129       ($r->class eq 'Constant' || $r->isRealNumber || $r->{isPower}));
00130 }

00135 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP Parser::BOP::divide);

00137 ##############################################
00138 
00139 package Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::power;
00140 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP Parser::BOP::power);
00141 
00142 #
00143 #  Base must be 'e' (then we know the other is the complex
00144 #  since we only get here if exactly one term is complex)
00145 #
00146 sub checkComplex {
00147   my $self = shift;
00148   return 0 if $self->{equation}{context}{flags}{complex_format} eq 'cartesian';
00149   my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00150   $self->{isPower} = 1;
00151   return 1 if ($l->class eq 'Constant' && $l->{name} eq 'e' &&
00152            ($r->class eq 'Constant' || $r->{isMult} || $r->{isOp} ||
00153         $r->class eq 'Complex' && $r->{value}[0] == 0));
00154   $self->Error("Exponentials can only be of the form 'e^(ai)' in this context");
00155 }
00156 
00157 ##############################################
00158 ##############################################
00159 #
00160 #  Now we do the same for the unary operators
00161 #
00162 
00163 package Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::UOP;
00164 
00165 sub _check {
00166   my $self = shift;
00167   my $super = ref($self); $super =~ s/Legacy::LimitedComplex:://;
00168   &{$super."::_check"}($self);
00169   my $op = $self->{op}; $self->{isOp} = 1;
00170   if ($op->isRealNumber) {
00171     return unless $self->{equation}{context}{flags}{strict_numeric};
00172     return if $op->class eq 'Number';
00173   } else {
00174     return if $self->{op}{isMult} || $self->{op}{isPower};
00175     return if $op->class eq 'Constant' && $op->{name} eq 'i';
00176   }
00177   $self->Error("Your answer should be of the form %s",$self->theForm)
00178 }
00179 
00180 sub checkComplex {return 0}
00181 
00182 sub theForm {Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::theForm(@_)}

00196 #
00197 #  Absolute value does complex norm, so we
00198 #  trap that as well.
00199 #
00200 
00201 package Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::List::AbsoluteValue;
00202 our @ISA = qw(Parser::List::AbsoluteValue);
00203 
00204 sub _check {
00205   my $self = shift;
00206   $self->SUPER::_check;
00207   return if $self->{coords}[0]->isRealNumber;
00208   $self->Error("Can't take absolute value of Complex Numbers in this context");
00209 }

00214 package Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex;

00216 #
00217 #  Now build the new context that calls the
00218 #  above classes rather than the usual ones
00219 #
00220 
00221 my $context = $Parser::Context::Default::context{Complex}->copy;
00222 $Parser::Context::Default::context{LimitedComplex} = $context;
00223 $context->{name} = "LimtedComplex";
00224 
00225 #
00226 #  Override operator classes
00227 #
00228 $context->operators->set(
00229    '+' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::add'},
00230    '-' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::subtract'},
00231    '*' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::multiply'},
00232   '* ' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::multiply'},
00233   ' *' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::multiply'},
00234    ' ' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::multiply'},
00235    '/' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::divide'},
00236   ' /' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::divide'},
00237   '/ ' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::divide'},
00238    '^' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::power'},
00239   '**' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::BOP::power'},
00240   'u+' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::UOP::plus'},
00241   'u-' => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::UOP::minus'},
00242 );
00243 #
00244 #  Remove these operators and functions
00245 #
00246 $context->lists->set(
00247   AbsoluteValue => {class => 'Parser::Legacy::LimitedComplex::List::AbsoluteValue'},
00248 );
00249 $context->operators->undefine('_','U');
00250 $context->functions->disable('Complex');
00251 foreach my $fn ($context->functions->names) {$context->{functions}{$fn}{nocomplex} = 1}
00252 #
00253 #  Format can be 'cartesian', 'polar', or 'either'
00254 #
00255 $context->flags->set(complex_format => 'either');
